content.description: Though it is short, it makes up for it with steep, quality climbing and good grips. Off the belay is a bit heads up so please use a stick clip.
content.protection: 4 bolts to rap rings. Fun top out optional.
content.location: Upon arriving at Northern Exposure, follow the base of the wall west and downhill. You will eventually run into the route. It is situated on a small spire parallel to skyline. The route faces south but sun exposure only lasts for about an hour.

content.description:
Difficult climbing past the first 2 bolts, leads to a pleasant romp to the anchor. This can be taken to the top with a bit of gear to supplement the extra couple bolts.

Overshadowed by it's stellar neighbors; this route still packs a punch while being a much needed warm-up for the wall.
content.protection: Gym-climbers paradise... One only needs to clip to play.
content.location: Right most route on the upper ledge.

content.description: Although dubious rock quality abounds, the vast variety of holds more than makes up for it. Head on up the left most bolt line as you approach some of the steepest rock in the Gallatin. Once the steepness is surmounted, head out right for some sadly less than stellar climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: As Bill has aged, his bolt spacing has steadily decreased. Expect pleasant, worry-free climbing. 13 bolts to chains
content.location: This and the next 2 routes start on a ledge one encounters soon after dropping into the old Skyline descent gully. This and Against the Grain start behind a large pine. This is the left one.

content.description: Bipolar two pitch route. The first pitch climbs steep beautiful rock entirely on bolts with a nice little slab kicker. The second pitch is all gear and while the difficulty relents, decreasing rock quality keeps your head in the game.
content.protection: All bolts on P1, then all gear on P2.
content.location: 100 feet downhill from the prior three routes, this route starts just right of the corner that makes up the right side of the upper ledge.

content.description: Finally the old Grif and Thrasher project went down. Climb thin edges and slab to a final funky sequence before getting to the fun moderate finger crack.
content.protection: Bolts. Plus a few finger and off hand sized pieces for the crack. Can do from ground with 80 M. rope.
content.location: Starts on the colored panel to the right of Flight Risk. Climbs to the obvious finger crack to the same anchor as Flight Risk.

content.description: Both FAers decided this was one bizarre route. Amazing unique movement makes up the entirety of this schizophrenic route...Was the bolter drunk when thinking this was a line? Either way, consensus was that this microcrimping slab nightmare is a worthwhile addition and of far better quality than the rotten 5.10 up higher on the cliff.
content.protection: Bolts. Currently there is no belay anchor, and as one must commit over the chasm for the first bolt, a few finger size pieces might be recommended for the belayer.
content.location: Currently the rightmost route on the lower ledge.

content.description: Beautiful thin face and seams. Typical of the new hard routes in the canyon, yet of far better rock. None of the flakey garbage seen on most of the new routes these days. In your face until the end. This route ties into an old Griffin and Thrasher project that still needs attention...get on it too!
content.protection: Bolts with a finger sized piece to start
content.location: Either a 4th class scramble or couple bolts and gear 5.7 get you to the center of the lower ledge.

content.description: Unlike it's neighbors, this route climbs up completely bullet-proof stone. Perfect edges and side pulls abound...Enjoy the romp. Can be taken to the top with a bit of gear to supplement the extra couple bolts.
content.protection: Bolts, bolts, glorious bolts to a rap bolt anchor.
content.location: Center route on the first ledge. Directly behind tree.

content.description: Phenomenal, hyper slab tech climbing with a steep finish between Kung Fury and the ?Thrasher? project.
content.location: Starts off the right ledge. Access from the right or by the 2 bolt  5.4. Route begins on the four big flake features.
